name: places/ChIJLbf69oNZwokRiEWqaFf1FcM
formattedAddress: 190 Allen St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 190 Allen St, New York, NY 10002, USA

editorialSummary.text: Ultra-hip hotel offering sleek quarters, a Japanese restaurant & a beer garden, plus a rooftop pool.

originalText.text: I’m giving 2 stars mainly due to the nightclub on L7. We stayed on L4 and were told we wouldn’t hear it. You can hear it even with ear plugs. Would not recommend staying here unless you plan to go out every night. It’s a shame as the staff were friendly, location convenient and room/bathroom size was great. Recommend others to be wary of the noise from the club that’s bang in right middle level unless you’re in a PH.

originalText.text: Where does one begin? From false advertising a room to empty promises of a complimentary champagne bottle during a special weekend in NYC when I got engaged I would stay far away from this place. Not only was the experience horrible and the empty extra accommodations not fulfilled but they went on to charge me $35 per day for some sort of customer service fee when not only did they not meet the expectations but completely missed them by a long shot. Do yourself a favor and book any other hotel on the lower East side. Your money would be well spent elsewhere. One of the worst hotel experiences in my 36 years of being on planet earth.

Do yourself a favor and book any other hotel on the lower East side. Your money would be well spent elsewhere. One of the worst hotel experiences in my 36 years of being on planet earth.

originalText.text:
Trying to be trendy, but getting tired. We were in room 302 the pool is on 3, the restaurant and bar were below us on floor 2, the nightclub is up on the 7th floor. You need to leave your air conditioning on fan (for white noise ) all night long because street noise and the club make sleeping a little bit of a challenge.

The bathroom is essentially a glass structure in the middle of the room attempting to let light into the shower. Unfortunately glass is quite reflective for sound so it exacerbates noise. You hear your neighbors showering and shaving.

The lobby has a modern vibe with dark colors unfortunately elevators are often broken hurting the vibe.

All in I rate it a B- for atmosphere and condition.

originalText.text: Service desk was not helpful. They charged me $300 per room each for two nights for incidentals which was a total of $900 extra on top of my room rates. They said I will get it all back if nothing is broken or used. We definitely didn’t break anything nor use our eat any of their outdated food or drinks in the room nor did we watch their TV since we were out exploring. I received most of my incidentals back but I should’ve received the whole $300 per the rooms. But they charged me $70 for each room for incidentals and have no explanation. This place is a joke. Checking in staff was completely rude.

originalText.text: Came here for a birthday weekend. It was a nice hotel, but overpriced for what was offered. I have stayed in nicer places for the equivalent. Okay so the pros….location is great, room was very spacious and bathroom was amazing; staff was very friendly and accommodating; balcony was a nice addition although it was standing room only, they could put stools out there, which they should. . Now for the cons, rooftop bar was a nice little spot but outdoor area was not large at all, and all the reviews you hear about the music are true, you hear the club going to wee hours of the morning, soundproofing needs to be addressed. We were on the 5th floor and you could clearly hear everything on the 7th. Honestly, this hotel is good for party goers , but I would not recommend for families or business travel. It was not really a “restful” stay, more of a fun upbeat place good for a certain crowd or celebration event. I gave it four stars mainly for the room itself or it would have been three. Also the staff was really accommodating. Just a few tweaks could change things.
